title: Erdős #625: Chromatic vs Cochromatic Numbers of Random Graphs
description: For G(n, 1/2), does χ(G) - ζ(G) → ∞ almost surely? The cochromatic number ζ(G) allows color classes to be cliques or independent sets. Heckel/Steiner (2024) proved the difference is unbounded. Prize: $1000 (false) / $100 (true).

meta.author: Paul Erdős, John Gimbel, Heckel, Steiner

overview.historicalContext: Proposed by Erdős and Gimbel at a random graph conference in Poznań, Poland (1989). The cochromatic number generalizes proper coloring by allowing cliques as well as independent sets as color classes. Recent breakthroughs by Heckel and Steiner (2024) have shown the difference χ - ζ grows unboundedly.
overview.problemStatement: The cochromatic number ζ(G) is the minimum colors where each class induces a complete or empty graph. For random G(n, 1/2), does χ(G) - ζ(G) → ∞ almost surely? Known: n/(2 log₂ n) ≤ ζ(G) ≤ χ(G) ≤ (1+o(1))n/(2 log₂ n). Heckel conjecture: χ - ζ ≈ n/(log n)³.
overview.proofStrategy: We formalize cochromatic colorings, the random graph model G(n, 1/2), Bollobás's bounds, the Heckel-Steiner unboundedness result, Heckel's conjecture, and connections to clique/independence numbers. The formalization includes concentration inequalities and special graph classes.
keyInsights: Heckel conjecture: χ - ζ ≈ n/(log n)³
χ - ζ ≥ n^{1-ε} for ~95% of n (Heckel 2024c)

sections.title: Known Bounds
sections.summary: Bollobás bounds on χ and ζ

conclusion.summary: This formalization captures Erdős Problem #625 on the gap between chromatic and cochromatic numbers in random graphs. Despite the 2024 breakthrough showing the difference grows unboundedly, the precise asymptotic behavior remains open.
conclusion.implications: Resolution would illuminate the structural difference between proper colorings and cochromatic colorings in random graphs, with implications for graph coloring algorithms.
openQuestions: Does χ(G) - ζ(G) → ∞ almost surely? ($1000/$100 prize)
Is Heckel's conjecture χ - ζ ≈ n/(log n)³ correct?
What is the exact asymptotic of χ - ζ?
What is the concentration of ζ(G)?
